ratings.comment: Most unorganized and unclear teacher I have ever had.  I have no idea why an institution like UW continues to pay him.  3 assignments are assigned that are all subjective.  The grading requirements for them are all unclear and inconsistent.  Interesting topic and material, but not interesting enough to make the class worth taking with Hunt.

His presentation can be off-putting, he loves to go off on tangents, he seems disorganized, and he has very strong libertarian views.  That said, he teaches a very interesting class and forces you to seriously engage in ideas that you might otherwise dismiss outright.  Not perfect, but you might figure out what you think a little bit better.
So hard to follow during class. Goes off on tangents constantly. Go to lecture and take notes and you will be fine, if don't go your screwed. Not to harsh of grading.

Prof. Hunt is a courageous break from the militant statism so rampant among UW-Madison's faculty. Amazing how hard it is to find a philosophy professor who believes in self ownership here. Would highly recommend

The best philosophy professor I've had. Not necessarily "easy;" he expects students to engage seriously with readings & his own ideas on the subject matter. However, he's a brilliant and charismatic teacher, knows his stuff and has really sophisticated views of his own that are WORTH learning, even moreso than the readings, imo. Highly recommended
Lectures were extremely boring in a class that has topics that should be interesting to talk about. He knows the material really well but lectures were unorganized.

Confusing lectures. Rambles about stuff and you can't even tell when he moves on to a new topic. Lectures were sometimes unbearable to sit through. Your grade depends solely on TA and it doesn't help that TA is a hard grader. Horrible class!

I took business ethics with Hunt over the summer. He has a great sense of humor but his class is a little unorganized in my opinion. He tends to skip back and forth between ideas which can be very confusing sometimes, not to mention it makes your notes hard to read over. All in all, good guy and decent class.

Amazing person (opinionated, but openminded). Amazing class. Hunt assigns only a few pages per class, which is helpful because you end up really learning the material. Rather than wasting time, reading and forgetting, you discuss the material extensively and explore its intricacies. I highly recommend this class. (He also wears amazing ties.)

Had him this summer for the 3 week session of Philos 243. Quite intensive given the amount of reading every day. I'm an international student so I found it kinda challenging to take notes during class cuz his thoughts could be very disorganized and confusing. But he managed to provoke some serious discussions every class so I like him.

I guess this prof just is not for everyone. I really like him and find his lectures thought provoking and interesting but I guess others do not. I recommend him to anyone interested in taking contemporary moral issues.
I really like professor Hunt. His lectures were thought-provoking, and he managed to stimulate discussion every lecture.

Hard to understand, if you read the articles your better off.  Likes to slide the boards up and down, very distracting. When you ask a question he literally says things like "huh" and "i don't get it" he can't comprehend that you might not understand what he is saying. Discussions are very helpful. 1 Exam, 6 page term paper and final.

Writes random stuff on the board and rambles... He interrupts himself all the time so my notes never make any sense because I have zero complete thoughts. Grade completely depends on your TA because he/she does all the grading as far as I can tell.
He...was..horrible. Rambled during "lecture" barely any notes on the board and expected us just to magically know with horrible teaching

The profs focus seemed to be on the most insignificant parts of Nietzsche's philosophy. Most lectures were spent discussing minutiae. Incoherent rambles are a more appropriate label than "lectures". I left the class more frustrated each day. Read mostly from Zarathustra (which isnt necessarily bad) but didn't spend sufficient time on other works.
I loved the class! It was interesting and enjoyable!

I really don't see where others are coming from here.  I thought Hunt was the best professor I've ever had here, and I thoroughly enjoyed his lectures and the way he presented the material.  All essay questions on tests are provided in advance, also.
I enjoyed the lectures immensely.  It's a good class anyway, but he really made it enjoyable, considering the TA was awkward in discussion section.

Fairly enthusiastic, but at the cost of coherence. Also the toughest grader I ever had as an undergrad philo major. I could not for the life of me figure out what he was looking for on papers and tests.
Worst. Professor. Ever. It wouldn't be hard, if he didn't ramble about pointless bs with no organization for an entire semester. I'm so disappointed. Take it with Hausman instead!
No Comments
